review: 垃圾游戏。SB暴雪
感觉……不如三国杀

1. I paid $60 for Overwatch on PC when it released. Why are you taking away something I spent money on? I understand why Blizzard feels the need to change the game and make corrections but why strip us of the game we paid for.

2. The new monetization scheme is absolutely horrendous for both new and old players. I mean $20 for a skin that came out 6 years ago and was free with the original OW credits, are you serious? This part feels like a sick joke to us original players and is just flat out disrespectful. The battle pass is also terrible but I’ll get into that.

3. Terrible battle pass system that rewards players for paying and gives the people who don’t pay practically nothing for playing the game. I understand it’s a F2P game and skins shouldn’t be why people play, but it’s just dumb to force people to pay for the battle pass if the want to earn anything interesting especially since most of us have already bought OW.  Yes new heroes are "free" but free if u take the game as a second job in order to grind to tier 41 in order to get the new hero.

4. Extremely buggy and terrible launch. I don’t even need to go into detail for this one.

5. Lack of anything new, yes they may have updated UI, added some new heroes and maps, reworked 6v6 into 5v5, and made changes to existing heroes, but why does this need to be an entirely “new” game? It feels like the same game to me aside from balancing certain things out but honestly the UI is a complete downgrade for me.

6. Lack of new skins and content, I understand that this is more of a nitpick but like why is a skin $20 when it is basically just a re-color of the default skin? This if for multiple heroes too. 
7. Still requiring specific phone numbers for new users. This is stupid. I don’t even know what else to say I feel like I could go on and on but what’s the point. Blizzard won’t listen to me or anyone else because they are a selfish and greedy company that views their fans as nothing more than consumers (which most are). I can’t help at least writing a review for this game though. Shame on blizzard for this ****
blizzard are genuine scum and this game is missed potential on so many fronts, purely in the name of making more money regardless of how it may negatively affect the game and its consumer base.

I love this game despite my misgivings about blizzard management and activision just being straight up evil.
obnoxious babies will complain about everything and review bomb the game anywhere they can but the actual community that plays the game honestly isnt even that bad. its rare to see games where an "acab" or a "trans rights" isn't met with positivity. (especially with the new-ish pride icons and banners, most games have at least one other repping queer)

So this is a difficult one... 
But I'll do my best. Is the game good? Absolutely!
Is the company bad? Absolutely.
Is the game predatory? Absolutely.

But is the experience great? Yes.
Is the world immersive? Yes.
Is the art amazing? Yes.
Does it have a Hero that summons a Fox? YES!

What can I say? Foxes earn my favor.
I recommend not spending money on this game though. Just play it casually and have fun since the gameplay is great.

winton overwat

I'm deeply disappointed with Overwatch 2, and I believe the decision to make a sequel was a complete misstep. Instead of improving upon what already worked in Overwatch 1, the developers chose to strip away many key aspects from the original, which ultimately led to a decline in the gameplay quality.

The promises of a PvE mode, which were supposed to be a central point of Overwatch 2, turned out to be nothing more than a marketing ploy. Rather than delivering a full-fledged and satisfying PvE experience as part of the base game, the developers opted to truncate this mode and sell it in packs for an additional $15. It's a blatant attempt to squeeze extra money from players without delivering anything of real value.

Overall, Overwatch 2 seems to be an attempt to maximize profits from the franchise rather than focusing on delivering satisfaction to fans of the original game. The developers should have concentrated on expanding and refining existing mechanics and content instead of introducing paid add-ons that should rightfully be an integral part of the game.

In conclusion, Overwatch 2 is a classic example of how to tarnish a good brand through greed and poor design decisions. The developers lost touch with what players truly wanted and instead focused on profit extraction, which resulted in a decline in the game's quality and the community's trust.

I play Overwatch 2 to remind me that suffering is a necessary part of the human condition and experience and that if I were to purely indulge myself in experiences of "fun" and "entertainment", I would be nothing more than a selfish, hedonistic, degenerate. (I am but thats besides the point)

I got more skins in the last week of O1 than I have in the couple hundred hours I have on this game, Its a joke, and the PVE mission is like a Strike in Destiny 2. Save your Money, Time and Disk space.

Blizzard if you wanna bring a game to steam, bring good ones Like the Diablo games or maybe even WoW.

Оставлю свой отзыв, как профессионального игрока, который наиграл в эту игру более 900 часов за 7 лет.
Overwatch 2 - это ловушка. Вы играете в ту же первую часть, но с ужасными ценами на скины в магазине, НЕокупаемым бп и плохой оптимизацией (первая часть шла спокойно на ультрах)

Какие плюсы я для себя выделил:
1) 5х5. Играть за танков стало более динамичнее (с Райнхардта пересел на Королеву Стервятников)
2) Бесплатные награды. Их мало, но все же есть.
3) Ностальгия. Иногда сюда и вправду приятно возвращаться.

Теперь к минусам:
1) Донат-донат и еще раз донат. Не хотите донатить - гриндите валюту, играя в Овер множество часов.
2) Баги. В первой части их было очень мало, во второй их прибавилось в разы.
3) СИЛЬНО урезанный PvE контент, в частности отмененная система прокачки героев.
4) Новые герои. То, от чего Джефф Каплан отказался в свое время, теперь ввели в игру. Надо также гриндить матчи, чтобы разблокировать нового героя.
5) Никакой любви разработчиков к своему коммьюнити. Мало того, что старым игрокам разработчики подарили два халтурных скина, причем один из них был скин Шута на Сомбру, так в процессе существования второй части, Blizzard "раздала" легендарные скины на Твиче, хотя я уверен, что некоторые игроки тратили свои деньги, чтобы их выбить.

Перечислять могу много и долго. Я НЕ РЕКОМЕНДУЮ переходить в эту игру на постоянной основе, и я не прощу Blizzard практически отмененный PvE, из-за которой впринципе и делалась вторая часть.
Что вы делали 5 лет? Ответ я думаю напрашивается сам.
В любом случае, Blizzard вас обманет.

What a great game amazing game i love it amazing !

Je précise : ne faites pas attention aux avis négatifs ce n'est clairement pas visé sur le jeu mais ce sont des haters qui déteste BLIZZARD, le studio de développement du jeu. Le jeu en lui-même est juste le MEILLEUR fps du genre pour moi. Ce jeu est de toute manière réellement plaisant à jouer et excellent. 

Overwatch n'a pas de réel concurrent, c'est le seul fps à proposer des héros vraiment variés, ils ont tous un gameplay intéressant et amusant, un lore, une histoire, des graphismes très très jolis, franchement le jeu de manière générale est très qualitatif. Mises en scènes, animations, on dirait un film PIXAR !
C'est également le seul FPS à proposer autant de modes de jeux, de contenu, du PVE, des events vraiment travaillés. Il faut l'admettre.  
Les gens critiquent mais j'ai beau chercher, aucun autre FPS sur le marché ne propose tout ce contenu et toute cette qualité.
Et le pire c'est que le jeu est essentiellement gratuit.  

La seule chose qu'on pourrait reprocher c'est la boutique de skin payante et un pass de combat mais j'ai envie de dire, quel jeu ne propose pas de skin de nos jours ? Surtout un jeu free to play. Ce n'est que du cosmétique. (Le seul réel défaut sont les prix de la boutique et des choses payantes là je suis d'accord)

Au final je fini toujours par retourner sur le jeu. J'ai envie de me faire quelques games tous les soirs, de progresser, les parties sont rapides. Je m'amuse. Je prends du plaisir. C'est le principal non ? 
Le jeu contient de nombreux joueurs et une grosse communauté. Les rageux perdront du temps à venir critiquer et les autres seront en train de s'amuser tout simplement. 

Bon jeu !
Hot garbage. They Turned OW1 into this? Give me a break.

No i ja się pytam, człowieku, czy jesteś dumny z siebie? Zdajesz sobie sprawę z tego, co robisz w świecie Overwatch? Masz ty w ogóle rozum i szacunek dla innych graczy? Ja nie wiem, ale żałosny typ z ciebie. Chyba nie pomyślałeś nawet, jakie konsekwencje mają twoje działania i jak wpływasz na innych. Możesz sobie wyzywać tych, co na to zasłużyli, ale nie można obrażać graczy, którzy cenią sobie tę grę i poświęcają jej czas. I tak wyjątkowa i ważna, bo to nie jest tylko gra, którą można lekceważyć, tak ci się podoba. Nie wiem, jakie masz doświadczenie w grach, ale chyba nie rozumiesz, co to znaczy dla wielu ludzi. Jeśli myślisz, że jesteś pro, to jesteś zwykłym noobem, którego ktoś jeszcze nie nauczył, jak się zachować w społeczności graczy. Nie wiem, co w tym jest takiego zabawnego, ale czep się raczej swojej postaci i umiejętności, a nie obrażaj innych.

Jak można w ogóle publicznie wyśmiewać innych graczy na forach internetowych? Ja się pytam, kto powinien za to odpowiedzieć, bo chyba widać, że nie zrozumiałeś jeszcze ducha gry. Jeśli nie interesuje cię Overwatch, to może znajdź sobie inną grę, a nie truj innych graczy swoim negatywnym podejściem. To ty chyba jesteś jakiś frustratem, że grasz tylko po to, żeby robić zamęt. Weź pod uwagę, ile osób czerpie radość z Overwatch, to nie tylko ty i twoje zachowanie. Ona ma swoją społeczność i historię. Ty kim jesteś, żeby w ogóle oceniać innych? Pomyślałeś w ogóle nad tym, że twoje komentarze nie tylko ranią, ale mogą zniechęcić innych do gry? Weź, przemyśl to, naprawdę. Bo w przeciwności do ciebie, niektórzy gracze naprawdę cieszą się grą i chcą się rozwijać. A ty? Nie wiem, czy kiedykolwiek zrozumiesz, co to znaczy być częścią tej społeczności. Widać, że nie rozumiesz, że gry to nie tylko rozrywka, ale też pasja i hobby dla wielu. To nie wiem, jak chcesz to sobie zrozumieć, ale może warto zastanowić się, zanim napiszesz coś obraźliwego na temat czegoś, co dla innych ma wartość. Ciekawe, czy byś się odważył powiedzieć takie rzeczy twarzą w twarz graczom, którzy są oddani grze.

Naprawdę, weźcie się, gracze, zastanówcie się, co wy robicie. Bo nie macie widać pojęcia, ile osób kocha Overwatch. Jak nie jesteście w pełni zanurzeni w tym świecie, to nie wydaje się, żebyście mieli podstawy do oceny i krytyki. Nie chodzi tutaj tylko o umiejętności, ale ogólnie o respekt wobec innych graczy, żeby mieć jakąś kulturę i zrozumienie. Bo Overwatch to gra, która łączy ludzi, a ty swoim zachowaniem możesz tylko zepsuć to doświadczenie. Bo nie widzisz, że twoje słowa nie tylko obrażają, ale mogą także zrujnować nastrój innych. Co? No, powiedz, za co atakujesz taką grę jak Overwatch? Brak mi słów, ale może, gdybyś chociaż zrozumiał sens tej gry i jakie ma znaczenie dla wielu, to byś się odmienił.

Nie wiem, może zamiast krytykować, spróbuj zrozumieć, dlaczego ludzie kochają Overwatch. Nie masz tego obowiązku, ale może zastanów się, zanim wypowiesz swoje negatywne zdanie. Nie musisz uwielbiać tej gry, ale przynajmniej uszanuj tych, którzy to robią. Nie widać, że Overwatch to nie tylko kawałek kodu, ale emocje, relacje, wspólne chwile. Nie lubisz Overwatch? To chociaż zostaw innych w spokoju i nie obrażaj innych graczy.

Begone foul demon, begone back to your greedy grubby little hole and never return to this land. Bold of you to come to a platform that allows it's users to give public feedback and expect anything different than what is happening.

What to say? I was an "onlywatch"er, the term gave to people who watched Seagull and other streamers who played while the game was in a lengthy beta. I was obsessed with the game before it even launched. A time when community feedback was of the utmost importance. Monthly developer updates from Jeff spoke to the community and let everyone know where the game was headed and that it was cared for. Fast forward, the game launched and it was a pop culture phenomenon that took over the world. Friends and I obsessively played for 5 years as the care continued to pour in from the highly respected Blizzard devs. Got an Overwatch tattoo with my crew. Invited a guy I met from Overwatch half way across the continent to my Wedding. I LOVED the game. Then Bobby Kotick decided the $$ numbers weren't big enough. The content was choked. We still played though. A little less frequently but the anticipation of #2 had us holding on. To see what Overwatch has become, it's pathetic. World was their oyster. Rumours of a Netflix Show. An entire sports like league I had tickets to go to. Movies. A new PvE expansion. They went with a "sequel" though. Clear money grab in all ways imaginable. Hands down the worst sequel of all time. Everything they once built has been pissed away for battlepass garbage. The game has lost all sense of direction with mind boggling gameplay changes. The care the developers once had is so very clearly gone. Trend setting, genre defining game no more. I beg of you not to download or play this game. Boycotting this abomination is the only thing that can maybe bring back the game I once loved, but I'm starting to think it's too late. The world could use more heroes, Don't play this game.

Overwatch 2 is the new era of Overwatch - Overwatch 2 is the cruel reanimation of the corpse of the greatest fps since Counter Strike.

Overwatch 1 was the accidental creation of a dysfunctional development team, the most promising franchise ever created. The original development team could not handle the lightning they had bottled and squandered their every opportunity. Years later, Overwatch 2 is an attempt by shareholders to extract every possible dollar they can from the IP before it is inevitably given up on by the player base.

The divine spark still remains. This game can be saved. But it will not be. Activision Blizzard, the shareholders and the CEO, Bobby Kotick, see no problem. To them, there is no art to cherish here - only money to be made. That is all it is to them. All it will ever be.

Things will never improve. It has never been more over.

If you're looking for a cash-grab "live-service" game with battle pass and overpriced microtransactions, guess what? This is your lucky day! Overwatch 2 is a shadow of original Overwatch. While it is still Overwatch at its heart and fun to play, the game is not rewarding at all. Putting heroes and PvE missions (aka Archive event) behind the paywall and replacing lootboxes with battle pass and shop left little to no motivation to play this game whatsoever.

P.S. Thank you Blizzard for putting Overwatch 2 on Steam so I can finally write the brutally honest review and get it off my chest

Overwatch 1 was one of my favorite games of all time, despite its awful balancing, repetitive events and eventual developer neglect.

Overwatch 2, on the other hand, is the result of somehow furthering that developer neglect, going 0.5 steps forward and going more than 100 steps back with the most boring gameplay loop, toxic fanbase, egregious monetization, soulless atmosphere and stereotypical free-to-play live service model in the history of this declining industry we call “gaming.”

Overwatch 1 was a game for all skill levels and type of players. Overwatch 2, on the other hand, is a game for nobody.

Pros:
+ The visuals are still vibrant and colorful, I guess
+ There’s plenty of accessibility options, from crosshair customization to toggling hold/tap for certain abilities
+ You don't need to install the Battle.net client to play the game on Steam
+ I mean... Game still runs really well, framerate-wise. You won't get high framerates from low - max settings in other games the way you do in this game.
+ the Training Mode offered in this game is the same as Overwatch 1's: versatile, vertical, excellent and offers the tools you need to test new heroes

Mid:
+- Character cast is diverse, but with a big caveat; the characters take a lot of time to unlock. To further this, newer heroes are locked every season behind a slow-progressing battle pass that forces you to pay for the new hero otherwise, or be forced to wait a whole season to complete a long set of challenges, creating balancing and pay-to-win controversy. The newer characters also feel super uninspired and designed purely around a game's current state instead of legitimate innovation.
+- the UI gets the job done but looks basic and soulless compared to the first game
+- Custom games and its community offer more creativity than the actual developers... but the game doesn't reward you in any way 

Cons:
- No game, whether F2P or a paid live-service, has had monetization as bastardized, greedy, overinflated as Overwatch 2. $20 skins and somehow being worse than Valorant’s $100 skin bundles is some of the biggest dog-shittery I’ve seen, even for typical greedy corporate monetization standards. The battle pass is also the lowest-quality, heaviest-grinding, pathetic battle pass in gaming history. Also, forcing people to pay $15 for three PvE missions that take 30 minutes to beat *total* is a no-go, especially when that money can be used towards full games and DLC that last far longer and provide better entertainment value. 
- PvE is false promises after false promises: skill trees, campaign-tied character progression and a free trial for Invasion missions that we were promised were all removed to prioritize the cash-grab that is the live-service aspect of this game, mixed with incompetent direction by the higher-ups and the developers' laziness, blatantly admitted during their PvE update livestream... 
- It took 5 whole in-game seasons (10 months) to bring back "On Fire:" a LEGACY FEATURE that used to make players feel good about good play, but now showers you with the same feature over one *assist* and nothing else
- Ranked/Competitive is grindy, inconsistent, tedious and unrewarding
- Queue times are still bad like post-2018 Overwatch 1
- Hacking/cheating is a far bigger issue than it was in Overwatch 1
- Servers are far more unstable than Overwatch 1: packet burst from bad connections that previously weren't an issue in the first game with bad ping 
- The 5v5 format and passives across all 3 roles caused further balancing issues across both the character cast and the pace of the game; causes further steamrolling/one-sided games, makes supports feel like get-out-of-jail-free mobile rats, tanks just better DPS that feel like brick walls to shoot at, etc.
- The yearly recycled events make the gameplay loop feel even more boring; now purely a cashgrab with almost no way to earn skins for free
- For some reason, new accounts now require not just phone verification, but specifically, smartphone/phone-plan verification.
- Push is an ABOMINATION that goes everything against Overwatch stands for; awkward spawns that take too long to reach objective, camping objective, high ground and flank spam, one-sided matches where losing the first engagement basically loses you the whole match, OBJ-robot is dumb, etc. 
- For some reason, map pools/rotations exist? In a game that used to not remove and cycle maps? When the game is already lacking in content???
- Endorsements no longer mean anything when all it does is *occasionally* offer 1/5th of a single battle pass tier... out of a whopping 80 tiers. Keyword: Occasionally
- Arcade offers pointless party modes that get old quick... no longer including the incentive to play for free cosmetics! 

Heroes were promised to never be paywalled... look where that led us.

PvE was promised to be grand with replayability and skill trees... Where are they?

Skins that were once obtainable for FREE... now locked behind $10 - 20 paywalls... EACH, with $30 - 60 bundles... What?!?!? Helps less that you can only get 60 Coins a WEEK... out of 1000 - 1900 PER SKIN.

What was once a fun game is now one of, if not the most boring, greedy, soulless, repetitive, fundamentally awful and unrewarding experiences of ALL TIME that serves as nothing but the living definition of everything wrong with the gaming industry today, alongside Blizzard's downfall from their glory days.

All in all, I regret to inform everyone reading this essay of a review that as a massive fan of Overwatch 1, I suffered whilst writing this review as much as I suffered playing this sorry, lazy, lying excuse of a so-called "sequel."
